coredata.dc:title: Rituals in organizations: A review and expansion of current theory

abstract.ce:para: This article integrates material from the study of rites, rituals, and ceremonies to apply these constructs to the study of organizations. A brief history of the study of the constructs is offered. Theories concerning the components, types, and functions of rites, rituals, and ceremonies are described, followed by a survey of field research in organizations that applies these theories. Conclusions about the current state of knowledge in the field are followed by implications for future study. © 2009 Sage Publications.

subject-areas.subject-area: Organizational Behavior and Human Resource Management

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2013 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Rituals in organizations: A review and expansion of current theory

abstract.ce:para: This article integrates material from the study of rites, rituals, and ceremonies to apply these constructs to the study of organizations. A brief history of the study of the constructs is offered. Theories concerning the components, types, and functions of rites, rituals, and ceremonies are described, followed by a survey of field research in organizations that applies these theories. Conclusions about the current state of knowledge in the field are followed by implications for future study. © 2009 Sage Publications.
